support_summary: FBXL3, an F-box protein and a component of the SKP1-Cullin-F-box (SCF) ubiquitin ligase complex, reduces the levels of ATXN3, suggesting a direct role in its degradation pathway. [23]

functions.cellular_process: FBXL3, an F-box protein component of an SCF (SKP1-Cullin-F-box) E3 ubiquitin ligase complex, targets ATXN3 for degradation.
functions.effect_description: FBXL3 is involved in regulating the turnover of ATXN3 protein. By incorporating into an SCF complex, it mediates the ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of ATXN3, thereby controlling its cellular levels.
biological_consequence: FBXL3 is part of an SCF E3 ligase complex → The complex binds and ubiquitinates ATXN3 → ATXN3 is degraded by the proteasome → ATXN3 protein levels are reduced
specific_effects: FBXL3 reduces the protein levels of ATXN3.

mechanism: FBXL3, an F-box protein component of an SCF (SKP1-Cullin-F-box) E3 ubiquitin ligase complex, targets ATXN3 for degradation.
effect: FBXL3 is involved in regulating the turnover of ATXN3 protein. By incorporating into an SCF complex, it mediates the ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of ATXN3, thereby controlling its cellular levels.
summary: ATXN3 inhibits FBXL3 to modulate atxn3 protein stability, ultimately affecting atxn3 protein levels are reduced.
